title: David Haye released from London hospital after doctors decide against operating on his Achilles injury
text:

David Haye has been released from hospital hours following his defeat to Tony Bellew - after doctors decide not to operate on him. 
The Hayemaker appeared to injure his right Achilles in the sixth round but refused to throw in the towel, bravely continuing on one leg until the penultimate round when the bout was stopped. 
He was rushed to a local hospital after the fight but has returned to his home today to recuperate. 
Haye went into the fight as the heavy favourite to defeat Bellew but quickly struggled to land his power punches against the conservative Bellew. Haye struggles to his feet after being knocked down (Photo: REUTERS) Haye is batted through the ropes (Photo: REUTERS) Haye's ankle twists in the sixth round (Photo: REUTERS) Haye has severe taping on his right leg (Photo: REUTERS) Haye and Bellew embrace after the fight (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Will David Haye retire? Mirror Sport's boxing expert David Anderson thinks he should 
Haye, who rushed to Munich to see specialist sports doctor Hans Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt before the fight, bravely battled on, throwing hopeful hooks - some of which caught the Bomber, who seemed to gas in the second half of the fight. 
He was then battered through the ropes in the 11th round and despite rising to his feet, trainer Shane McGuigan chucked the towel into the ring with the referee waving the contest off. Read More
